q: The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing.
h:
“The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Love doesn't need reason. It speaks from the irrational wisdom of the heart.
h:
“Love doesn't need reason. It speaks from the irrational wisdom of the heart.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Whatever is begun in anger, ends in shame.
h:
“Whatever is begun in anger, ends in shame.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: If the only prayer you ever say in your entire life is thank you, it will be enough.
h:
“If the only prayer you ever say in your entire life is thank you, it will be enough.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: Why do you stay in prison when the door is so wide open?
h:
“Why do you stay in prison when the door is so wide open?” —
Rumi

q: Care about what other people think and you will always be their prisoner.
h:
“Care about what other people think and you will always be their prisoner.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Here is the test to find whether your mission on earth is finished. If you're alive, it isn't.
h:
“Here is the test to find whether your mission on earth is finished. If you're alive, it isn't.” —
Richard Bach

q: Till it has loved, no man or woman can become itself.
h:
“Till it has loved, no man or woman can become itself.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: Make failure your teacher, not your undertaker.
h:
“Make failure your teacher, not your undertaker. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: There is only the one reality, neither to be realized nor attained.
h:
“There is only the one reality, neither to be realized nor attained.” —
Huang Po

q: Don't just sit there. Do something. The answers will follow.
h:
“Don't just sit there. Do something. The answers will follow.” —
Mark Manson

q: Desire for the fruits of work must never be your motive in working.
h:
“Desire for the fruits of work must never be your motive in working.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: Don't gain the world and lose your soul. Wisdom is better than silver and gold.
h:
“Don't gain the world and lose your soul. Wisdom is better than silver and gold.” —
Bob Marley

q: Longevity is a fleeting moment that lasts forever.
h:
“Longevity is a fleeting moment that lasts forever.” —
Vidal Sassoon

q: The birth of the mind is the death of the senses.
h:
“The birth of the mind is the death of the senses.” —
Dan Millman

q: Absorb what is useful, discard what is not, add what is uniquely your own.
h:
“Absorb what is useful, discard what is not, add what is uniquely your own.” —
Bruce Lee

q: Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not
h:
“Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not” —
Pablo Picasso

q: Success on the outside means nothing unless you also have success within.
h:
“Success on the outside means nothing unless you also have success within.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Only by attracting the best people will you accomplish great deeds.
h:
“Only by attracting the best people will you accomplish great deeds.” —
Colin Powell

q: Words are clothes that thoughts wear
h:
“Words are clothes that thoughts wear” —
Samuel Butler

q: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
h:
“Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Smile, breathe and go slowly.
h:
“Smile, breathe and go slowly.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: Just living is not enough... one must have sunshine, freedom, and a little flower.
h:
“Just living is not enough... one must have sunshine, freedom, and a little flower. ” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: Love yourself with the same intensity you would use to pull yourself up if you were hanging off a cliff.
h:
“Love yourself with the same intensity you would use to pull yourself up if you were hanging off a cliff.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: It's better to have a short life that is full of what you like doing, than a long life spent in a miserable way.
h:
“It's better to have a short life that is full of what you like doing, than a long life spent in a miserable way.” —
Alan Watts

q: To create more positive results in your life, replace 'if only' with 'next time'.
h:
“To create more positive results in your life, replace 'if only' with 'next time'.” —
Celestine Chua

q: A dead thing can go with the stream, but only a living thing can go against it.
h:
“A dead thing can go with the stream, but only a living thing can go against it.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: He who is not contented with what he has, would not be contented with what he would like to have.
h:
“He who is not contented with what he has, would not be contented with what he would like to have.” —
Socrates

q: Lost Time is never found again.
h:
“Lost Time is never found again.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: It's your life; you don't need someone's permission to live the life you want. Be brave to live from your heart.
h:
“It's your life; you don't need someone's permission to live the life you want. Be brave to live from your heart.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: All know that the drop merges into the ocean, but few know that the ocean merges into the drop.
h:
“All know that the drop merges into the ocean, but few know that the ocean merges into the drop.” —
Kabir

q: The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.
h:
“The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: Peace begins with a smile.
h:
“Peace begins with a smile.” —
Mother Teresa

q: You can live a whole life time never being awake.
h:
“You can live a whole life time never being awake.” —
Dan Millman

q: We learn to walk by falling down. If we never fell down, we would never walk.
h:
“We learn to walk by falling down. If we never fell down, we would never walk.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Everyone must choose one of two pains: The pain of discipline or the pain of regret.
h:
“Everyone must choose one of two pains: The pain of discipline or the pain of regret.” —
Jim Rohn

q: If you go out looking for friends, you're going to find they are very scarce. If you go out to be a friend, you'll find them everywhere.
h:
“If you go out looking for friends, you're going to find they are very scarce. If you go out to be a friend, you'll find them everywhere.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: There is no failure except in no longer trying. There is no defeat except from within, no insurmountable barrier except our own inherent weakness of purpose.
h:
“There is no failure except in no longer trying. There is no defeat except from within, no insurmountable barrier except our own inherent weakness of purpose.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: Do you have the patience to wait until your mud settles and the water is clear?
h:
“Do you have the patience to wait until your mud settles and the water is clear?” —
Lao Tzu

q: At first dreams seem impossible, then improbable, then inevitable.
h:
“At first dreams seem impossible, then improbable, then inevitable.” —
Christopher Reeve

q: Nothing is impossible. The word itself says 'I'm possible!'
h:
“Nothing is impossible. The word itself says 'I'm possible!'” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: Most people fail in life because they major in minor things.
h:
“Most people fail in life because they major in minor things.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Wherever you are is the entry point.
h:
“Wherever you are is the entry point.” —
Kabir

q: The soul is neither born, and nor does it die.
h:
“The soul is neither born, and nor does it die.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: Before anything else, preparation is the key to success.
h:
“Before anything else, preparation is the key to success.” —
Alexander Graham Bell

q: What are we doing here, that is the question.
h:
“What are we doing here, that is the question.” —
Samuel Beckett

q: The wisest men follow their own direction.
h:
“The wisest men follow their own direction.” —
Euripides

q: Hope is not a strategy. Luck is not a factor. Fear is not an option.
h:
“Hope is not a strategy. Luck is not a factor. Fear is not an option.” —
James Cameron

q: Everyone can rise above their circumstances and achieve success if they are dedicated to and passionate about what they do.
h:
“Everyone can rise above their circumstances and achieve success if they are dedicated to and passionate about what they do.” —
Nelson Mandela

q: I cannot make my days longer so I strive to make them better.
h:
“I cannot make my days longer so I strive to make them better.” —
Henry David Thoreau
